And it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken<S>8085</S> diligently<S>8085</S> unto the voice<S>6963</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, to observe<S>8104</S> and to do<S>6213</S> all his commandments<S>4687</S> which I command<S>6680</S> thee this day<S>3117</S>, that the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S> will set<S>5414</S> thee on high<S>5945</S> above all nations<S>1471</S> of the earth<S>776</S>:
And all these blessings<S>1293</S> shall come<S>935</S> on thee, and overtake<S>5381</S> thee, if thou shalt hearken<S>8085</S> unto the voice<S>6963</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>.
Blessed<S>1288</S> shalt thou be in the city<S>5892</S>, and blessed<S>1288</S> shalt thou be in the field<S>7704</S>.
Blessed<S>1288</S> shall be the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy body<S>990</S>, and the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy ground<S>127</S>, and the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy cattle<S>929</S>, the increase<S>7698</S> of thy kine<S>504</S>, and the flocks<S>6251</S> of thy sheep<S>6629</S>.
Blessed<S>1288</S> shall be thy basket<S>2935</S> and thy store<S>4863</S>. <sup>store: or, dough, or, kneadingtroughs</sup>
Blessed<S>1288</S> shalt thou be when thou comest in<S>935</S>, and blessed<S>1288</S> shalt thou be when thou goest out<S>3318</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall cause<S>5414</S> thine enemies<S>341</S> that rise up<S>6965</S> against thee to be smitten<S>5062</S> before thy face<S>6440</S>: they shall come out<S>3318</S> against thee one<S>259</S> way<S>1870</S>, and flee<S>5127</S> before<S>6440</S> thee seven<S>7651</S> ways<S>1870</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall command<S>6680</S> the blessing<S>1293</S> upon thee in thy storehouses<S>618</S>, and in all that thou settest<S>4916</S> thine hand<S>3027</S> unto; and he shall bless<S>1288</S> thee in the land<S>776</S> which the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S> giveth<S>5414</S> thee. <sup>storehouses: or, barns</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall establish<S>6965</S> thee an holy<S>6918</S> people<S>5971</S> unto himself, as he hath sworn<S>7650</S> unto thee, if thou shalt keep<S>8104</S> the commandments<S>4687</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, and walk<S>1980</S> in his ways<S>1870</S>.
And all people<S>5971</S> of the earth<S>776</S> shall see<S>7200</S> that thou art called<S>7121</S> by the name<S>8034</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>; and they shall be afraid<S>3372</S> of thee.
And the LORD<S>3068</S> shall make thee plenteous<S>3498</S> in goods<S>2896</S>, in the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy body<S>990</S>, and in the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy cattle<S>929</S>, and in the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy ground<S>127</S>, in the land<S>127</S> which the LORD<S>3068</S> sware<S>7650</S> unto thy fathers<S>1</S> to give<S>5414</S> thee. <sup>in goods: or, for good</sup> <sup>body: Heb. belly</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall open<S>6605</S> unto thee his good<S>2896</S> treasure<S>214</S>, the heaven<S>8064</S> to give<S>5414</S> the rain<S>4306</S> unto thy land<S>776</S> in his season<S>6256</S>, and to bless<S>1288</S> all the work<S>4639</S> of thine hand<S>3027</S>: and thou shalt lend<S>3867</S> unto many<S>7227</S> nations<S>1471</S>, and thou shalt not borrow<S>3867</S>.
And the LORD<S>3068</S> shall make<S>5414</S> thee the head<S>7218</S>, and not the tail<S>2180</S>; and thou shalt be above only<S>4605</S>, and thou shalt not be beneath<S>4295</S>; if that thou hearken<S>8085</S> unto the commandments<S>4687</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, which I command<S>6680</S> thee this day<S>3117</S>, to observe<S>8104</S> and to do<S>6213</S> them:
And thou shalt not go aside<S>5493</S> from any of the words<S>1697</S> which I command<S>6680</S> thee this day<S>3117</S>, to the right hand<S>3225</S>, or to the left<S>8040</S>, to go<S>3212</S> after<S>310</S> other<S>312</S> gods<S>430</S> to serve<S>5647</S> them.
But it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken<S>8085</S> unto the voice<S>6963</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, to observe<S>8104</S> to do<S>6213</S> all his commandments<S>4687</S> and his statutes<S>2708</S> which I command<S>6680</S> thee this day<S>3117</S>; that all these curses<S>7045</S> shall come<S>935</S> upon thee, and overtake<S>5381</S> thee:
Cursed<S>779</S> shalt thou be in the city<S>5892</S>, and cursed<S>779</S> shalt thou be in the field<S>7704</S>.
Cursed<S>779</S> shall be thy basket<S>2935</S> and thy store<S>4863</S>.
Cursed<S>779</S> shall be the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy body<S>990</S>, and the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy land<S>127</S>, the increase<S>7698</S> of thy kine<S>504</S>, and the flocks<S>6251</S> of thy sheep<S>6629</S>.
Cursed<S>779</S> shalt thou be when thou comest in<S>935</S>, and cursed<S>779</S> shalt thou be when thou goest out<S>3318</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall send<S>7971</S> upon thee cursing<S>3994</S>, vexation<S>4103</S>, and rebuke<S>4045</S>, in all that thou settest<S>4916</S> thine hand<S>3027</S> unto for to do<S>6213</S>, until thou be destroyed<S>8045</S>, and until thou perish<S>6</S> quickly<S>4118</S>; because<S>6440</S> of the wickedness<S>7455</S> of thy doings<S>4611</S>, whereby thou hast forsaken<S>5800</S> me. <sup>for: Heb. which thou wouldest do</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall make the pestilence<S>1698</S> cleave<S>1692</S> unto thee, until he have consumed<S>3615</S> thee from off the land<S>127</S>, whither thou goest<S>935</S> to possess<S>3423</S> it.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall smite<S>5221</S> thee with a consumption<S>7829</S>, and with a fever<S>6920</S>, and with an inflammation<S>1816</S>, and with an extreme burning<S>2746</S>, and with the sword<S>2719</S>, and with blasting<S>7711</S>, and with mildew<S>3420</S>; and they shall pursue<S>7291</S> thee until thou perish<S>6</S>. <sup>sword: or, drought</sup>
And thy heaven<S>8064</S> that is over thy head<S>7218</S> shall be brass<S>5178</S>, and the earth<S>776</S> that is under thee shall be iron<S>1270</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall make<S>5414</S> the rain<S>4306</S> of thy land<S>776</S> powder<S>80</S> and dust<S>6083</S>: from heaven<S>8064</S> shall it come down<S>3381</S> upon thee, until thou be destroyed<S>8045</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall cause<S>5414</S> thee to be smitten<S>5062</S> before<S>6440</S> thine enemies<S>341</S>: thou shalt go out<S>3318</S> one<S>259</S> way<S>1870</S> against them, and flee<S>5127</S> seven<S>7651</S> ways<S>1870</S> before<S>6440</S> them: and shalt be removed<S>2189</S> into all the kingdoms<S>4467</S> of the earth<S>776</S>. <sup>removed: Heb. for a removing</sup>
And thy carcase<S>5038</S> shall be meat<S>3978</S> unto all fowls<S>5775</S> of the air<S>8064</S>, and unto the beasts<S>929</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, and no man shall fray them away<S>2729</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> will smite<S>5221</S> thee with the botch<S>7822</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, and with the emerods<S>2914</S> <S>6076</S>, and with the scab<S>1618</S>, and with the itch<S>2775</S>, whereof thou canst<S>3201</S> not be healed<S>7495</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall smite<S>5221</S> thee with madness<S>7697</S>, and blindness<S>5788</S>, and astonishment<S>8541</S> of heart<S>3824</S>:
And thou shalt grope<S>4959</S> at noonday<S>6672</S>, as the blind<S>5787</S> gropeth<S>4959</S> in darkness<S>653</S>, and thou shalt not prosper<S>6743</S> in thy ways<S>1870</S>: and thou shalt be only oppressed<S>6231</S> and spoiled<S>1497</S> evermore<S>3117</S>, and no man shall save<S>3467</S> thee.
Thou shalt betroth<S>781</S> a wife<S>802</S>, and another<S>312</S> man<S>376</S> shall lie<S>7901</S> <S>7693</S> with her: thou shalt build<S>1129</S> an house<S>1004</S>, and thou shalt not dwell<S>3427</S> therein: thou shalt plant<S>5193</S> a vineyard<S>3754</S>, and shalt not gather the grapes<S>2490</S> thereof. <sup>gather: Heb. profane, or, use it as common meat</sup>
Thine ox<S>7794</S> shall be slain<S>2873</S> before thine eyes<S>5869</S>, and thou shalt not eat<S>398</S> thereof: thine ass<S>2543</S> shall be violently taken away<S>1497</S> from before thy face<S>6440</S>, and shall not be restored<S>7725</S> to thee: thy sheep<S>6629</S> shall be given<S>5414</S> unto thine enemies<S>341</S>, and thou shalt have none to rescue<S>3467</S> them. <sup>shall not: Heb. shall not return to thee</sup>
Thy sons<S>1121</S> and thy daughters<S>1323</S> shall be given<S>5414</S> unto another<S>312</S> people<S>5971</S>, and thine eyes<S>5869</S> shall look<S>7200</S>, and fail<S>3616</S> with longing for them all the day<S>3117</S> long: and there shall be no might<S>410</S> in thine hand<S>3027</S>.
The fruit<S>6529</S> of thy land<S>127</S>, and all thy labours<S>3018</S>, shall a nation<S>5971</S> which thou knowest<S>3045</S> not eat up<S>398</S>; and thou shalt be only oppressed<S>6231</S> and crushed<S>7533</S> alway<S>3117</S>:
So that thou shalt be mad<S>7696</S> for the sight<S>4758</S> of thine eyes<S>5869</S> which thou shalt see<S>7200</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall smite<S>5221</S> thee in the knees<S>1290</S>, and in the legs<S>7785</S>, with a sore<S>7451</S> botch<S>7822</S> that cannot<S>3201</S> be healed<S>7495</S>, from the sole<S>3709</S> of thy foot<S>7272</S> unto the top of thy head<S>6936</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall bring<S>3212</S> thee, and thy king<S>4428</S> which thou shalt set<S>6965</S> over thee, unto a nation<S>1471</S> which neither thou nor thy fathers<S>1</S> have known<S>3045</S>; and there shalt thou serve<S>5647</S> other<S>312</S> gods<S>430</S>, wood<S>6086</S> and stone<S>68</S>.
And thou shalt become an astonishment<S>8047</S>, a proverb<S>4912</S>, and a byword<S>8148</S>, among all nations<S>5971</S> whither the LORD<S>3068</S> shall lead<S>5090</S> thee.
Thou shalt carry<S>3318</S> much<S>7227</S> seed<S>2233</S> out<S>3318</S> into the field<S>7704</S>, and shalt gather<S>622</S> but little<S>4592</S> in<S>622</S>; for the locust<S>697</S> shall consume<S>2628</S> it.
Thou shalt plant<S>5193</S> vineyards<S>3754</S>, and dress<S>5647</S> them, but shalt neither drink<S>8354</S> of the wine<S>3196</S>, nor gather<S>103</S> the grapes; for the worms<S>8438</S> shall eat<S>398</S> them.
Thou shalt have olive trees<S>2132</S> throughout all thy coasts<S>1366</S>, but thou shalt not anoint<S>5480</S> thyself with the oil<S>8081</S>; for thine olive<S>2132</S> shall cast<S>5394</S> his fruit.
Thou shalt beget<S>3205</S> sons<S>1121</S> and daughters<S>1323</S>, but thou shalt not enjoy them; for they shall go<S>3212</S> into captivity<S>7628</S>. <sup>thou shalt not: Heb. they shall not be thine</sup>
All thy trees<S>6086</S> and fruit<S>6529</S> of thy land<S>127</S> shall the locust<S>6767</S> consume<S>3423</S>. <sup>consume: or, possess</sup>
The stranger<S>1616</S> that is within<S>7130</S> thee shall get up<S>5927</S> above thee very<S>4605</S> high<S>4605</S>; and thou shalt come down<S>3381</S> very<S>4295</S> low<S>4295</S>.
He shall lend<S>3867</S> to thee, and thou shalt not lend<S>3867</S> to him: he shall be the head<S>7218</S>, and thou shalt be the tail<S>2180</S>.
Moreover all these curses<S>7045</S> shall come<S>935</S> upon thee, and shall pursue<S>7291</S> thee, and overtake<S>5381</S> thee, till thou be destroyed<S>8045</S>; because thou hearkenedst<S>8085</S> not unto the voice<S>6963</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, to keep<S>8104</S> his commandments<S>4687</S> and his statutes<S>2708</S> which he commanded<S>6680</S> thee:
And they shall be upon thee for a sign<S>226</S> and for a wonder<S>4159</S>, and upon thy seed<S>2233</S> for<S>5704</S> ever<S>5769</S>.
Because thou servedst<S>5647</S> not the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S> with joyfulness<S>8057</S>, and with gladness<S>2898</S> of heart<S>3824</S>, for the abundance<S>7230</S> of all things;
Therefore shalt thou serve<S>5647</S> thine enemies<S>341</S> which the LORD<S>3068</S> shall send<S>7971</S> against thee, in hunger<S>7458</S>, and in thirst<S>6772</S>, and in nakedness<S>5903</S>, and in want<S>2640</S> of all things: and he shall put<S>5414</S> a yoke<S>5923</S> of iron<S>1270</S> upon thy neck<S>6677</S>, until he have destroyed<S>8045</S> thee.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall bring<S>5375</S> a nation<S>1471</S> against thee from far<S>7350</S>, from the end<S>7097</S> of the earth<S>776</S>, as swift as the eagle<S>5404</S> flieth<S>1675</S>; a nation<S>1471</S> whose tongue<S>3956</S> thou shalt not understand<S>8085</S>; <sup>understand: Heb. hear</sup>
A nation<S>1471</S> of fierce<S>5794</S> countenance<S>6440</S>, which shall not regard<S>5375</S> the person<S>6440</S> of the old<S>2205</S>, nor shew favour<S>2603</S> to the young<S>5288</S>: <sup>of fierce: Heb. strong of face</sup>
And he shall eat<S>398</S> the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy cattle<S>929</S>, and the fruit<S>6529</S> of thy land<S>127</S>, until thou be destroyed<S>8045</S>: which also shall not leave<S>7604</S> thee either corn<S>1715</S>, wine<S>8492</S>, or oil<S>3323</S>, or the increase<S>7698</S> of thy kine<S>504</S>, or flocks<S>6251</S> of thy sheep<S>6629</S>, until he have destroyed<S>6</S> thee.
And he shall besiege<S>6887</S> thee in all thy gates<S>8179</S>, until thy high<S>1364</S> and fenced<S>1219</S> walls<S>2346</S> come down<S>3381</S>, wherein<S>2004</S> thou trustedst<S>982</S>, throughout all thy land<S>776</S>: and he shall besiege<S>6887</S> thee in all thy gates<S>8179</S> throughout all thy land<S>776</S>, which the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S> hath given<S>5414</S> thee.
And thou shalt eat<S>398</S> the fruit<S>6529</S> of thine own body<S>990</S>, the flesh<S>1320</S> of thy sons<S>1121</S> and of thy daughters<S>1323</S>, which the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S> hath given<S>5414</S> thee, in the siege<S>4692</S>, and in the straitness<S>4689</S>, wherewith thine enemies<S>341</S> shall distress<S>6693</S> thee: <sup>body: Heb. belly</sup>
So that the man<S>376</S> that is tender<S>7390</S> among you, and very<S>3966</S> delicate<S>6028</S>, his eye<S>5869</S> shall be evil<S>3415</S> toward his brother<S>251</S>, and toward the wife<S>802</S> of his bosom<S>2436</S>, and toward the remnant<S>3499</S> of his children<S>1121</S> which he shall leave<S>3498</S>:
So that he will not give<S>5414</S> to any<S>259</S> of them of the flesh<S>1320</S> of his children<S>1121</S> whom he shall eat<S>398</S>: because he hath nothing left<S>7604</S> him in the siege<S>4692</S>, and in the straitness<S>4689</S>, wherewith thine enemies<S>341</S> shall distress<S>6693</S> thee in all thy gates<S>8179</S>.
The tender<S>7390</S> and delicate<S>6028</S> woman among you, which would not adventure<S>5254</S> to set<S>3322</S> the sole<S>3709</S> of her foot<S>7272</S> upon the ground<S>776</S> for delicateness<S>6026</S> and tenderness<S>7391</S>, her eye<S>5869</S> shall be evil<S>3415</S> toward the husband<S>376</S> of her bosom<S>2436</S>, and toward her son<S>1121</S>, and toward her daughter<S>1323</S>,
And toward her young one<S>7988</S> that cometh out<S>3318</S> from between her feet<S>7272</S>, and toward her children<S>1121</S> which she shall bear<S>3205</S>: for she shall eat<S>398</S> them for want<S>2640</S> of all things secretly<S>5643</S> in the siege<S>4692</S> and straitness<S>4689</S>, wherewith thine enemy<S>341</S> shall distress<S>6693</S> thee in thy gates<S>8179</S>. <sup>young one: Heb. afterbirth</sup>
If thou wilt not observe<S>8104</S> to do<S>6213</S> all the words<S>1697</S> of this law<S>8451</S> that are written<S>3789</S> in this book<S>5612</S>, that thou mayest fear<S>3372</S> this glorious<S>3513</S> and fearful<S>3372</S> name<S>8034</S>, THE LORD<S>3068</S> THY GOD<S>430</S>;
Then the LORD<S>3068</S> will make<S>6381</S> thy plagues<S>4347</S> wonderful<S>6381</S>, and the plagues<S>4347</S> of thy seed<S>2233</S>, even great<S>1419</S> plagues<S>4347</S>, and of long continuance<S>539</S>, and sore<S>7451</S> sicknesses<S>2483</S>, and of long continuance<S>539</S>.
Moreover he will bring<S>7725</S> upon thee all the diseases<S>4064</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, which thou wast afraid<S>3025</S> of<S>6440</S>; and they shall cleave<S>1692</S> unto thee.
Also every sickness<S>2483</S>, and every plague<S>4347</S>, which is not written<S>3789</S> in the book<S>5612</S> of this law<S>8451</S>, them will the LORD<S>3068</S> bring<S>5927</S> upon thee, until thou be destroyed<S>8045</S>. <sup>bring: Heb. cause to ascend</sup>
And ye shall be left<S>7604</S> few<S>4592</S> in number<S>4962</S>, whereas<S>834</S> ye were as the stars<S>3556</S> of heaven<S>8064</S> for multitude<S>7230</S>; because thou wouldest not obey<S>8085</S> the voice<S>6963</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>.
And it shall come to pass, that as the LORD<S>3068</S> rejoiced<S>7797</S> over you to do you good<S>3190</S>, and to multiply<S>7235</S> you; so the LORD<S>3068</S> will rejoice<S>7797</S> over you to destroy<S>6</S> you, and to bring you to nought<S>8045</S>; and ye shall be plucked<S>5255</S> from off the land<S>127</S> whither thou goest<S>935</S> to possess<S>3423</S> it.
And the LORD<S>3068</S> shall scatter<S>6327</S> thee among all people<S>5971</S>, from the one end<S>7097</S> of the earth<S>776</S> even unto the other<S>7097</S>; and there thou shalt serve<S>5647</S> other<S>312</S> gods<S>430</S>, which neither thou nor thy fathers<S>1</S> have known<S>3045</S>, even wood<S>6086</S> and stone<S>68</S>.
And among these<S>1992</S> nations<S>1471</S> shalt thou find no ease<S>7280</S>, neither shall the sole<S>3709</S> of thy foot<S>7272</S> have rest<S>4494</S>: but the LORD<S>3068</S> shall give<S>5414</S> thee there a trembling<S>7268</S> heart<S>3820</S>, and failing<S>3631</S> of eyes<S>5869</S>, and sorrow<S>1671</S> of mind<S>5315</S>:
And thy life<S>2416</S> shall hang<S>8511</S> in doubt before<S>5048</S> thee; and thou shalt fear<S>6342</S> day<S>3119</S> and night<S>3915</S>, and shalt have none assurance<S>539</S> of thy life<S>2416</S>:
In the morning<S>1242</S> thou shalt say<S>559</S>, Would God it were<S>5414</S> even<S>6153</S>! and at even<S>6153</S> thou shalt say<S>559</S>, Would God it were<S>5414</S> morning<S>1242</S>! for the fear<S>6343</S> of thine heart<S>3824</S> wherewith thou shalt fear<S>6342</S>, and for the sight<S>4758</S> of thine eyes<S>5869</S> which thou shalt see<S>7200</S>.
And the LORD<S>3068</S> shall bring<S>7725</S> thee into Egypt<S>4714</S> again<S>7725</S> with ships<S>591</S>, by the way<S>1870</S> whereof I spake<S>559</S> unto thee, Thou shalt see<S>7200</S> it no more again<S>3254</S>: and there ye shall be sold<S>4376</S> unto your enemies<S>341</S> for bondmen<S>5650</S> and bondwomen<S>8198</S>, and no man shall buy<S>7069</S> you.
